Module contents¶

class pym.auth.AuthProvider(sess, user_class)¶

Bases: builtins.object

load_by_principal(principal)¶

Loads a user instance by principal.

login_by_email(request, email, pwd, remote_addr)¶

Logs user in by email and password, returns principal instance.

Raises exception pym.exc.AuthError if user is not found.

login_by_identity_url(request, identity_url, remote_addr)¶

Logs user in by identity URL (OpenID), returns principal instance.

Raises exception pym.exc.AuthError if user is not found.

login_by_principal(request, principal, pwd, remote_addr)¶

Logs user in by principal and password, returns principal instance.

Raises exception pym.exc.AuthError if user is not found.

logout(request, uid)¶

Performs logout.

pym.auth.group_finder(userid, request)¶

Returns list of security principals of the currently logged in user.

A principal starting with u: denotes the user, with g: denotes a group. We use the IDs as identifier.

Nobody has no principals.

Param ‘userid’ must match principal of current user, else throws error.
